item.title: Branch Broken Hanging Low, 4th August
item.description:
A large branch of the mirabelle plum tree within the compound at the Anerley Road end of the Croydon Canal has partially snapped and it hanging dangerously low. A storm could dislodge it completely. There is no immediate danger to the public as it is in a closed area, but it could pose a danger to the Friends' workshed and engine room. Please send a tree surgeon to remove the branch (not the entire tree).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 192, Anerley Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intersection of Chichele Road, Cricklewood Broadway and Cricklewood Lane, 4th August
item.description:
More than a month ago, yellow information panels were installed, as a result of some works that were to take place in the area. These signs were installed a month before the works began, and it has already been 3 weeks since the works were completed, and these yellow information panels have not disappeared from there, they are placed at every corner of the intersection on the sidewalks, blocking the safe movement of citizens. Someone needs to go and take them away urgently
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cricklewood Broadway, London
Report on FixMyStreet
